Posts.Content: Guardian-Angel wrote: Hi. I am 21 years old and was just diagnosed with a fibroadenoma following a Ultrasound due to 2 months of pain in my breast. The doctor at the screening center said that it was nothing and very common in women my age and that it could be left alone. I haven't gone to see my doctor following the results though and I am afraid she might suggest removing it. My mother had a fibroadenoma in her 30's and removed it with surgery. She suggests I leave it alone and monitor it regularly as the surgery itself causes pain and leaves a big scar. I am still weighing my options and would absolutely have it removed if the doctor informed me of any danger of having fibroadenomas. My aunt who was recenly diagnosed with BC at 49, also had a fibroadenoma when she was my age. However, other than her case,  there is no other family history of any cancers in my family, but this also has me worried. My question is are fibroadenomas a precursor to BC? Does having an aunt with BC put me at higher risk? Have any of you had fibroadenomas in the past and how have you managed them? I know I have a lot of questions but I admit my diagnosis as well as my aunt's diagnosis has gotten me worried. Any advice would be extremely appreciated! Log in to post a reply
